channel.title: Papers with Code: Trending (unofficial)
channel.description: As a disclaimer, this is an unofficial feed and has no affiliation with Papers with Code.

item.title: Qwen2.5-Coder Technical Report
item.description: In this report, we introduce the Qwen2. 5-Coder series, a significant upgrade from its predecessor, CodeQwen1. 5.

item.title: garak: A Framework for Security Probing Large Language Models
item.description: As Large Language Models (LLMs) are deployed and integrated into thousands of applications, the need for scalable evaluation of how models respond to adversarial attacks grows rapidly.

item.title: Watermark Anything with Localized Messages
item.description: Image watermarking methods are not tailored to handle small watermarked areas.

item.title: Region-Aware Text-to-Image Generation via Hard Binding and Soft Refinement
item.description: Regional prompting, or compositional generation, which enables fine-grained spatial control, has gained increasing attention for its practicality in real-world applications.

item.title: MinerU: An Open-Source Solution for Precise Document Content Extraction
item.description: Document content analysis has been a crucial research area in computer vision.

item.title: LLM2CLIP: Powerful Language Model Unlocks Richer Visual Representation
item.description: In this paper, we propose LLM2CLIP, a novel approach that embraces the power of LLMs to unlock CLIP's potential.

item.title: Cut Your Losses in Large-Vocabulary Language Models
item.description: We implement a custom kernel that performs the matrix multiplications and the log-sum-exp reduction over the vocabulary in flash memory, making global memory consumption for the cross-entropy computation negligible.

item.title: The Dawn of GUI Agent: A Preliminary Case Study with Claude 3.5 Computer Use
item.description: The recently released model, Claude 3. 5 Computer Use, stands out as the first frontier AI model to offer computer use in public beta as a graphical user interface (GUI) agent.

item.title: Docling Technical Report
item.description: This technical report introduces Docling, an easy to use, self-contained, MIT-licensed open-source package for PDF document conversion.

item.title: In-Context LoRA for Diffusion Transformers
item.description: While task-specific in terms of tuning data, our framework remains task-agnostic in architecture and pipeline, offering a powerful tool for the community and providing valuable insights for further research on product-level task-agnostic generation systems.

item.title: Hallo2: Long-Duration and High-Resolution Audio-Driven Portrait Image Animation
item.description: To the best of our knowledge, Hallo2, proposed in this paper, is the first method to achieve 4K resolution and generate hour-long, audio-driven portrait image animations enhanced with textual prompts.

item.title: LightRAG: Simple and Fast Retrieval-Augmented Generation
item.description: Retrieval-Augmented Generation (RAG) systems enhance large language models (LLMs) by integrating external knowledge sources, enabling more accurate and contextually relevant responses tailored to user needs.

item.title: D-FINE: Redefine Regression Task in DETRs as Fine-grained Distribution Refinement
item.description: When pretrained on Objects365, D-FINE-L / X attains 57. 1% / 59. 3% AP, surpassing all existing real-time detectors.

item.title: SplatFormer: Point Transformer for Robust 3D Gaussian Splatting
item.description: To our knowledge, this is the first successful application of point transformers directly on 3DGS sets, surpassing the limitations of previous multi-scene training methods, which could handle only a restricted number of input views during inference.

item.title: TCSinger: Zero-Shot Singing Voice Synthesis with Style Transfer and Multi-Level Style Control
item.description: To address these challenges, we introduce TCSinger, the first zero-shot SVS model for style transfer across cross-lingual speech and singing styles, along with multi-level style control.

item.title: OmniGen: Unified Image Generation
item.description: In this work, we introduce OmniGen, a new diffusion model for unified image generation.

item.title: WikiChat: Stopping the Hallucination of Large Language Model Chatbots by Few-Shot Grounding on Wikipedia
item.description: WikiChat generates a response from an LLM, retains only the grounded facts, and combines them with additional information it retrieves from the corpus to form factual and engaging responses.

item.title: Face Anonymization Made Simple
item.description: Current face anonymization techniques often depend on identity loss calculated by face recognition models, which can be inaccurate and unreliable.

item.title: PyramidKV: Dynamic KV Cache Compression based on Pyramidal Information Funneling
item.description: Our experimental evaluations, utilizing the LongBench benchmark, show that PyramidKV matches the performance of models with a full KV cache while retaining only 12% of the KV cache, thus significantly reducing memory usage.

item.title: Composable Effects for Flexible and Accelerated Probabilistic Programming in NumPyro
item.description: NumPyro is a lightweight library that provides an alternate NumPy backend to the Pyro probabilistic programming language with the same modeling interface, language primitives and effect handling abstractions.
